items.sentence: I knew you wouldn\'t like the food at Chuck\'s Bar and Grill.
I don\'t want to get off on the wrong foot with the new boss.
How much fuel does a Boeing 747 carry for a nine-hour flight?
How would you feel if someone hacked into your email account?
Tom usually sleeps with his windows open, even in the winter.
I quit reading the novel because it wasn\'t very interesting.
I would\'ve gone to Boston with you if my parents had let me.
They\'re clearly not happy that they got stuck with that job.
Tom was the one who told Mary that her house had burned down.
Tom was the one who told me how to say "thank you" in French.
I always keep a set of fingernail clippers in my guitar case.
The party that we\'ve been invited to is tomorrow, not today.
Tom tried to give Mary some money, but she wouldn\'t take it.
Tom tried to reach the top shelf, but he wasn\'t tall enough.
You should always knock on the door before you enter my room.
You'd be a lot easier to get along with if you'd listen more.
Tom spent the whole day eating and drinking with his friends.
At least half the people in my neighborhood can speak French.
Tom asked Mary to throw the rotten apples in the garbage can.
In case you haven't noticed, I've been waiting for two hours.
